intro: Fidelia kalbfussioides, commonly known as the Kalbfus's fidelia, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to purple. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in shaded, humid forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
